DPRK-Russia Protocol Signed 
   Pyongyang, July 23 (KCNA) -- A protocol on the talks between the DPRK Minister of Railways and the chairman of the "Russian Railways" Company was signed at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Sunday.
 Present at the signing ceremony from the DPRK side were Vice-Minister of Railways Kim Chol and others and from the Russian side members of the delegation of the company and Russian Ambassador to the DPRK Andrei Karlov.    
 The protocol was inked by Kim Yong Sam, minister of Railways, and V.I. Yakunin, chairman of the company.

DPRK Players Prove Successful at Rowing Championships 
   Pyongyang, July 23 (KCNA) -- DPRK players gave a good account of themselves at the 11th Merlion Rowing Championships held in Singapore from July 16 to 18.
 Kim Kyong Un and Pae Sang Hyok took off gold medals at the men's light-weight double sculls, Pak Ok Ju and Kim Ok Bong at the women's light-weight double sculls and Ro Kum Suk at the women's heavy-weight single sculls.    
 Kang Jin Chol won a silver medal at the men's heavy-weight single sculls.

articles.content:
Greetings to Egyptian President
   Pyongyang, July 22 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, sent a message of greetings to Mohamed Hosni Mubarak , president of Egypt, on Friday on the occasion of the 54th anniversary of the July 23 revolution, the national holiday of the Egyptian people.
 Expressing the belief that the long-standing relations of friendship and cooperation between the two countries would grow stronger in the future, the message sincerely wished him and the Egyptian people greater successes in their work for stability and prosperity of the country and fair and comprehensive settlement of the Mideast issue.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Meets Delegation of Russian Company
articles.content:
Greetings to PM and FM of Egypt
   Pyongyang, July 22 (KCNA) -- Pak Pong Ju, premier of the DPRK Cabinet, sent a message of greetings to Ahmed Najef, prime minister of Egypt, on the occasion of the 54th anniversary of the July 23 revolution of the Egyptian people.
 The message sincerely wished the prime minister greater success in his responsible work for the development and prosperity of the country.    
 In the meantime, Foreign Minister of the DPRK Paek Nam Sun sent a similar message to his Egyptian counterpart Ahmed Abu al-Gheit.

articles.title: Gift to Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets Delegation of Russian Company
   Pyongyang, July 22 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, met and had a friendly talk with the delegation of the "Russian Railways" Company headed by its Chairman V. I. Yakunin at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Saturday.
 The chairman asked Kim Yong Nam to convey a personal letter of Russian President V. V. Putin to General Secretary Kim Jong Il.    
 Present there were Kim Yong Sam, minister of Railways, Kung Sok Ung, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, and officials concerned and Russian Ambassador to the DPRK Andrei Karlov.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung Remembered in Different Countries
articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Il
   Pyongyang, July 22 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il was presented with a gift by Chairman of the "Russian Railways" Company V. I. Yakunin who is leading the delegation of the company on a visit to the DPRK.
 He handed the gift to Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, on Saturday.
